title: Riksgalds Kontoret type id
content:
Hi,   
   
Can anyone name the typeface used in the attachment?   
   
Thanks   
iota.   
   
 ![riksgalds](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121134842im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/13063.jpg)

 [‹ Stencil-ish, but not Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121134842/http:/www.typophile.com/node/664 "Go to previous forum topic") [Pirates of the Caribbean movie ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121134842/http:/www.typophile.com/node/667 "Go to next forum topic")
author: iota

comments.content:
the short answer (if an answer after 11 hours can be considered a "short" answer) from Victoria is "almost"... it has some of the qualities of Nick Shinn's Beaufort Bold but, if I may say, without all of Beaufort's elegance. For example, the "S" is more stable in Beaufort, while the sample "S" seems to lean to the right a bit. The serifs differ significantly, as well.   
   
... will keep looking.

For me this is very close to   
Poppl Laudatio, see here:   
   
 [http://www.bertholdtypes.com/bq\_library/90089.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121134842/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/90089.html)
By the look of it it
